elements.Text: It can be very difficult for people to remember to take their anti-hormonal medicines, like Tamoxifen or an Aromatase Inhibitor. Everyone forgets to take their medicine at some point.
A tool that can be helpful for remembering to take your medicine is to establish a way to remind yourself to take it.
A reminder is something that triggers you to remember to take your anti-hormonal medicine every day.

For example, a reminder could be a note to yourself, an alarm, or anything else that will trigger you to remember to take your medicine.  A person can use more than one reminder to remember to take their medicine.
Do you currently have a reminder to take your medicine, like an alarm?
